 51
 52/// DMA Chain builder.
 53
 54class Chain_builder
 55{
 56public:
 57  Chain_builder()
 58    : chain_ ()
 59  {}
 60
 61  ~Chain_builder()
 62  {}
 63
 64  template <typename T>
 65  void add(ptrdiff_t start, int stride, unsigned length)
 66  {
 67    chain_.add(reinterpret_cast<void*>(start), sizeof(T), stride, length);
 68  }
 69
 70  template <typename T>
 71  void add(ptrdiff_t start,
 72	   int stride0, unsigned length0,
 73	   int stride1, unsigned length1)
 74  {
 75    for (unsigned i=0; i<length1; ++i)
 76      chain_.add(reinterpret_cast<void*>(start + sizeof(T)*i*stride1),
 77		 sizeof(T), stride0, length0);
 78  }
 79
 80  void* base() { return 0; }
 81
 82  Copy_chain get_chain()
 83  { return chain_; }
 84
 85  void stitch(void* base, Copy_chain chain)
 86  { chain_.append_offset(base, chain); }
 87
 88  void stitch(std::pair<void*, void*> base, Copy_chain chain)
 89  {
 90    chain_.append_offset(base.first,  chain);
 91    chain_.append_offset(base.second, chain);
 92  }
 93
 94  bool is_empty() const { return (chain_.size() == 0); }
 95
 96  // Private member data.
 97private:
 98  Copy_chain                    chain_;
 99};
100
101
102
103/// Communicator class.
104
105/// A VSIPL++ Communicator is essentially just an MPI Communicator at
106/// the moment.
107
108class Communicator
109{
110
111  struct Req_entry : public impl::Ref_count<Req_entry>
112  {
113    bool       done;
114
115    Req_entry() : done(false) {}
116  };
117  class Req;
118  friend class Req;
119  class Req
120  {
121  public:
122    Req() : entry_(new Req_entry, impl::noincrement) {}
123
124    void set(bool val) { (*entry_).done = val; }
125    bool get() { return (*entry_).done; }
126
127  private:
128    impl::Ref_counted_ptr<Req_entry> entry_;
129  };
130  struct Msg;
131  friend struct Msg;
132  struct Msg
133  {
134    Copy_chain  chain_;
135    Req         req_;
136    void*       memory_;
137
138    Msg(Copy_chain chain, Req req, void* memory = 0)
139      : chain_  (chain),
140	req_    (req),
141	memory_ (memory)
142      {}
143  };
144
145  typedef std::deque<Msg> msg_list_type;
146  struct Msg_list;
147  friend struct Msg_list;
148  struct Msg_list : public impl::Ref_count<Msg_list>
149  {
150    msg_list_type list_;
151  };
152
153public:
154  typedef Req                         request_type;
155  typedef Copy_chain                  chain_type;
156  typedef std::vector<processor_type> pvec_type;
157
158public:
159  Communicator()
160    : rank_ (0),
161      size_ (1),
162      msgs_ (new Msg_list, impl::noincrement),
163      pvec_ (size_)
164  {
165    for (index_type i=0; i<size_; ++i)
166      pvec_[i] = static_cast<processor_type>(i);
167  }
168
169  processor_type   rank() const { return rank_; }
170  length_type      size() const { return size_; }
171  pvec_type const& pvec() const { return pvec_; }
172
173  // barrier is no-op for serial execution.
174  void barrier() const {}
175
176  template <typename T>
177  void buf_send(processor_type dest_proc, T* data, length_type size);
178
179  template <typename T>
180  void send(processor_type dest_proc, T* data, length_type size,
181	    request_type& req);
182
183  void send(processor_type dest, chain_type const& chain, request_type& req);
184
185  template <typename T>
186  void recv(processor_type src_proc, T* data, length_type size);
187
188  void recv(processor_type dest, chain_type const& chain);
189
190  void wait(request_type& req);
191
192  template <typename T>
193  void broadcast(processor_type root_proc, T* data, length_type size);
194
195  template <typename T>
196  T allreduce(reduction_type rdx, T value);
197
198  par_ll_pset_type impl_ll_pset() const VSIP_NOTHROW
199  { return par_ll_pset_type(); }
200
201  friend bool operator==(Communicator const&, Communicator const&);
202
203private:
204  processor_type	    rank_;
205  length_type		    size_;
206  Ref_counted_ptr<Msg_list> msgs_;
207  pvec_type                 pvec_;
208};
209
210} // namespace vsip::impl::par_services
211

214typedef par_services_none::Communicator Communicator;
215typedef par_services_none::Chain_builder Chain_builder;
216typedef Chained_assign par_assign_impl_type;
217
218inline void
219create_ll_pset(
220  std::vector<processor_type> const&,
221  par_ll_pset_type&)
222{}
223
224inline void
225destroy_ll_pset(par_ll_pset_type&)
226{}
227
228inline void
229free_chain(Copy_chain const& /*chain*/)
230{
231}

233
234/// Par_service class for when no services are available.
235
236class Par_service
237{
238  // Compile-time values and typedefs.
239public:
240  typedef par_services_none::Communicator communicator_type;
241
242  // Constructors.
243public:
244  Par_service(int&, char**&)
245    : valid_(1)
246    {
247      assert(valid_);
248
249      default_communicator_ = communicator_type();
250    }
251
252  ~Par_service()
253    {
254      valid_ = 0;
255    }
256
257  static communicator_type& default_communicator()
258    {
259      return default_communicator_;
260    }
261
262private:
263  static communicator_type default_communicator_;
264
265  int			   valid_;
266};
267

270template <reduction_type rtype,
271	  typename       T>
272struct Reduction_supported
273{ static bool const value = true; };

278  Definitions

280
281namespace par_services_none
282{
283
284inline bool
285operator==(Communicator const& comm1, Communicator const& comm2)
286{
287  return comm1.msgs_.get() == comm2.msgs_.get();
288}
289
290
291
292inline bool
293operator!=(Communicator const& comm1, Communicator const& comm2)
294{
295  return !operator==(comm1, comm2);
296}
297
298
299
300template <typename T>
301inline void
302Communicator::buf_send(
303  processor_type dest_proc,
304  T*             data,
305  length_type    size)
306{
307  assert(dest_proc == 0);
308
309  T* raw = new T[size];
310
311  for (index_type i=0; i<size; ++i)
312    raw[i] = data[i];
313
314  // printf("buf_send %d (val %d) %08x\n", size, *raw, (int)raw);
315  Copy_chain chain;
316  chain.add(reinterpret_cast<void*>(raw), sizeof(T), 1, size);
317
318  msgs_->list_.push_back(Msg(chain, Req(), reinterpret_cast<void*>(raw)));
319}
320
321
322
323template <typename T>
324inline void
325Communicator::send(
326  processor_type dest_proc,
327  T*             data,
328  length_type    size,
329  request_type&  req)
330{
331  assert(dest_proc == 0);
332
333  // printf("send %d (val %d)\n", size, *data);
334  Copy_chain chain;
335  chain.add(reinterpret_cast<void*>(data), sizeof(T), 1, size);
336
337  req.set(false);
338  msgs_->list_.push_back(Msg(chain, req));
339}
340
341
342
343inline void
344Communicator::send(
345  processor_type    dest_proc,
346  chain_type const& chain,
347  request_type&     req)
348{
349  assert(dest_proc == 0);
350
351  // printf("send chain\n");
352  req.set(false);
353  msgs_->list_.push_back(Msg(chain, req));
354}
355
356
357
358template <typename T>
359inline void
360Communicator::recv(
361  processor_type   src_proc,
362  T*               data,
363  length_type      size)
364{
365  assert(src_proc == 0);
366  assert(msgs_->list_.size() > 0);
367
368  Msg msg = msgs_->list_.front();
369  msgs_->list_.pop_front();
370
371  // assert(msg.type_size_ == sizeof(T));
372  assert(msg.chain_.data_size() == size * sizeof(T));
373
374  msg.chain_.copy_into(data, size * sizeof(T));
375
376  msg.req_.set(true);
377
378  if (msg.memory_) delete[] static_cast<char*>(msg.memory_);
379}
380
381
382
383inline void
384Communicator::recv(
385  processor_type    src_proc,
386  chain_type const& chain)
387{
388  assert(src_proc == 0);
389  assert(msgs_->list_.size() > 0);
390
391  Msg msg = msgs_->list_.front();
392  msgs_->list_.pop_front();
393
394  // assert(msg.type_size_ == sizeof(T));
395  assert(msg.chain_.data_size() == chain.data_size());
396
397  msg.chain_.copy_into(chain);
398
399  msg.req_.set(true);
400
401  if (msg.memory_) delete[] static_cast<char*>(msg.memory_);
402}
403
404
405
406/// Wait for a previous communication (send or receive) to complete.
407
408inline void
409Communicator::wait(
410  request_type& req)
411{
412  // Since there is only one processor, we really can't wait for the
413  // receive to post.  Either it has, or it hasn't, in which case
414  // we are deadlocked.
415  assert(req.get() == true);
416}
417
418
419
420/// Broadcast a value from root processor to other processors.
421
422template <typename T>
423inline void
424Communicator::broadcast(processor_type root_proc, T*, length_type)
425{
426  assert(root_proc == 0);
427  // No-op: no need to broadcast w/one processor.
428}
429
430
431
432/// Reduce a value from all processors to all processors.
433
434template <typename T>
435inline T
436Communicator::allreduce(reduction_type, T value)
437{
438  return value;
439}
